title: Slow Clocks and Time
question_text: John's watch is slow and loses 2 minutes every hour. If John sets the correct time on his watch at 2 pm, what time will his watch show in exactly three hours?
Tina's watch is slow and loses 4 minutes every hour. If Tina sets the correct time on her watch at 3 pm, what time will her watch show in exactly four hours?
Jim's watch is slow and loses 3 minutes every hour. If Jim sets the correct time on his watch at 4 pm, what time will his watch show in exactly five hours?
Jenny's watch is slow and loses 5 minutes every hour. If Jenny sets the correct time on her watch at 5 pm, what time will her watch show in exactly six hours?
Fiona's watch is slow and loses 7 minutes every hour. If Fiona sets the correct time on her watch at 2 pm, what time will her watch show in exactly seven hours?
Matt's watch is slow and loses 9 minutes every hour. If Matt sets the correct time on his watch at 2 pm, what time will his watch show in exactly three hours?
Elena's watch is fast and gains 2 minutes every hour. If Elena sets the correct time on her watch at 2 pm, what time will her watch show in exactly four hours?
Joydeep's watch is fast and gains 2 minutes every hour. If Joydeep sets the correct time on his watch at 2 pm, what time will his watch show in exactly five hours?
Omar's watch is fast and gains 2 minutes every hour. If Omar sets the correct time on his watch at 2 pm, what time will his watch show in exactly six hours?
